FuncDef:
The passive-session detect-multiplier command changes the detection multiplier of a passive BFD session.
The undo passive-session detect-multiplier restores the default detection multiplier of a passive BFD session.
By default, the detection multiplier of a passive BFD session is 3.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the detection multiplier of a passive BFD session.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 50.

Specifies the peer IP address bound to a passive BFD session.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In the case of BFD for MPLS-TE, you can run the passive-session detect-multiplier command to change the detection multiplier of a passive BFD session with the specified peer IP address.
Prerequisites
BFD has been globally enabled using the bfd command in the system view.
